intro: Astragalus berytius, commonly known as the Cyprus milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Cyprus. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its seeds are small and often dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across suitable environments.
